page.title: 17OULTON HEATH
page.content: Oulton Heath has a well maintained tarmaced road with no pavements. On the right of this road (from Stone) it is enclosed rough grazing land, with a right of way through to the vilage of Oulton.There is an underground resevoir on this side. A few detached old country cottages, snow cemmed and renovated, but one at least (Golf Cottage) goes back to the early seventeenth century. On the other side of the road, almost opposite the right of way into Oulton village, is another right of way, at the left of Midfield Nurseries, through several fields out at Ford farm and to the Wash Dale Road. On the right is the Downsbanks. The Downsbanks stream crosses this road and over the stream is a wooden footbridge with railings.
